contentList:
Blindness Your eyes are destroyed; you gain the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blinded</LSTag> condition. Magic such as <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_LesserRestoration">Lesser Restoration</LSTag> can restore your sight. Your eyes are destroyed; you gain the blinded condition. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore your sight.
Partial Blindness Your eyes are damaged; you have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Perception">Perception</LSTag> checks that rely on sight and on ranged <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>. If you are already suffering from <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="Goon_Injury_Proxy_Grit_Glory_Partial_Blindness">Partial Blindness</LSTag> and are inflicted with it again, you instead gain the <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="Goon_Injury_Proxy_Grit_Glory_Blindness">Blindness</LSTag> injury. Magic such as <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_LesserRestoration">Lesser Restoration</LSTag> can restore your sight. Your eyes are damaged; you have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and on ranged attack rolls. Magic such as the regenerate spell can heal the damage to your eyes. If you have already suffered partial blindness, you're blinded.
Anosmia You lose your sense of smell and taste. You're immune to smells and tastes that would make you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STINKING_CLOUD">Nauseous</LSTag>. The condition heals if you receive any healing. You lose your sense of smell and taste. You automatically fail any ability checks that involve your sense of smell or taste. The condition heals if you receive any magical healing.
Destroyed Foot Your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> is halved. You fall prone after using the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Dash">Dash</LSTag> action. You have disadvantage on <LSTag Tooltip="Acrobatics">Acrobatics</LSTag> checks. Magic such as the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Regenerate">Regenerate</LSTag> spell can restore the damaged appendage. Your speed on foot is halved, and you must use a crutch or cane to move. You fall prone after using the Dash action. You have disadvantage on Dexterity checks made to balance. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore the damaged appendage.
Destroyed Hand You're <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="DISARM">Disarmed</LSTag> upon being injured. You have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on weapon attacks and <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag> while you're dual wielding melee or ranged weapons, wielding a two handed weapon or have a shield equipped. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore the damaged appendage. You can no longer hold anything with two hands, and you can hold only a single object at a time. Magic such as the regenerate spell can restore the lost appendage.
